[[Benedict XVI]] wrote his first encyclical on [[Deus caritas est|God is love]]. He argued that man, being made in the image of God who is love, is able to practice love: to give himself to others (agape) by receiving and experiencing God's love in contemplation (eros). This, according to him, has been the life of the saints such as [[Teresa of Calcutta]] and specially of the [[Blessed Virgin Mary]].<ref>[http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/benedict_xvi/encyclicals/documents/hf_ben-xvi_enc_20051225_deus-caritas-est_en.html Pope Benedict XVI, papal encyclical, Deus Caritas Est.]</ref>
